name: Marriott SpringHill Suites Old Montreal

reviews.text: Excellent location! Walking distance to old montreal, congress center, Saint Catherine Street, Saint Laurent, shopping, place des arts...
reviews.title: What more can you ask for? No complaints

reviews.text: Free breakfast buffet is excellent. Bring the paper plates from inside your microwave in the room and bring food back to your room.
reviews.title: Just Fabulous!

reviews.text: Room has fridge, tiny freezer and microwave. Internet is free and fairly fast.
reviews.title: Great hidden gem in Old Montreal

reviews.text: Beds and pillows are excellent with nice soft washable linens.
reviews.title: Good family value with plenty of space

reviews.text: Sound proof rooms and individually controlled temperature and Window that opens.
reviews.title: Marriott SpringHill Suites Old Montreal

reviews.text: Our family of five recently stayed here on a short trip to Montreal, and one of the reasons that I generally like SpringHill Suites is that their rooms nicely accommodate five. This hotel was no exception - the room was very spacious, including a small kitchen area and a huge bathroom. It was clean with ample towels, pillows, nice bedding, etc. The location is perfect, really in the heart of Old Montreal. We parked with valet parking and walked nearly everywhere (although we took the metro once, very convenient). The breakfast was definitely one of the better hotel breakfasts I've had, with the exception of the weak coffee. But the selection of pastries, eggs, waffles, fruit, yogurt, etc, was excellent. Staff were friendly and happy to talk to us in either French or English. Overall, no complaints!
reviews.title: Great for our family
Great location and rooms
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night while in Montreal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is MUCH better than the Marriott Chateau Champlain.
reviews.title: so many things not ok.

reviews.text: The location is great, on a narrow, quiet street.
reviews.title: Très bien!

reviews.text: This hotel is very busy with groups, although I didn't really encounter any issues.
reviews.title: Perfect Location to Explore Vieux Montreal

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights for business.
reviews.title: Nice location and friendly staff

reviews.text: Room was nice and big. I am not sure I would really call it a suite though, by just adding a partition between the sleeping and couch area. The room is kind of no-frill, but has what I needed, a fridge and a microwave. Nice touch to supply a couple wrapped paper plates and utensils. The hotel is in the middle of old Montreal, so easy walking distance to lots of nice restaurants and bar. But because it's tugged in a side street, there's not much of a view from my room.
reviews.title: About what you'd expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free breakfast (included in the room rate) was pretty good. You can make your waffle. I had dinner at the attached restaurant one night. Really good food. Recommended.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The swimming pool is really not a swimming pool, way too small for even kids to play in. And so was the gym, sad looking little corner with a couple treadmill and free weights. They should just demolish the place and make it a welcoming nicely equipped gym.
reviews.title: Great hotel! Great location! Best place to stay in Montreal.

reviews.text: Clean, close to Old Montreal, nice enough. Rooms are pretty small, though we did get a suite with a HUGE walkout terrace that my boys used to play catch...a lifesaver!! We had the biggest suite there but still tight for a family with 3 small kids. Breakfast was good but crowded. Perhaps our biggest disappointment was Montreal itself. We're from Chicago and agreed they could take a lesson from our streets and sanitation department! We went to Toronto last year and it was spotless...assumed Montreal would be the same, but garbage and dirt kind of just laying around everywhere. Old Montreal was also quite dead, aside from some bars in the evening. Mostly TACKY trinket shops or businesses that seemed closed for the season (or forever?). Perhaps it was the time of year, but if that's the case then only go to Montreal in the summer! Mt Royal was nice, Notre Dame, Marche Jean Talon, etc were great. Skip Olympic park. Truly depressing. Barron, unmaintained concrete jungle that looks like a George Orwell novel. Even the ring of flags were all tattered and torn.
reviews.title: Oui! Oui!
Comfortable, functional but a little tired.
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great, but some of the decor looks at home in the 90's. Rooms were clean, comfortable and functional. Breakfast was fine, but not enough room when it got busy, plus a strange culture of kids coming to breakfast in their pyjamas! Also everything at breakfast was disposable, so not very environmentally friendly or nice. The staff were really friendly and helpful, as were most people in this interesting city.

Depressing hotel. My so called Suite was simply a room divided up with partial walls making each space too small to enjoy. Even though the room-carpet was "high hide" it was visibly dirty. that in my opinion is unacceptable. The bathroom was clean but extremely basic and the sink area was tiny.
reviews.title: Far below my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The air conditioner/heater/fan was literally a foot away from one side of the bed. It could not set it to a comfortable temperature. The fan on the unit blew hard enough to keep the curtains flapping 24/7. I could not see a setting to turn it off. I'm glad it was business trip and I was alone, so nobody had to sleep beside it. The wall paper in the room was slightly peeling. Seems like an easy fix, apply a little glue and voila... so why would the hotel ignore that.
reviews.title: very happy

reviews.text: The bed linens were thin and basic.
reviews.title: Great location in the old port - nice big rooms and the restaurant is terrific!

reviews.text: The Valet service was strange. You were required to drive you car into the garage then the valet staff took the car deeper into the parking lot. The valet staff were very friendly, no complaint with them, it's just a very strange valet service.
reviews.title: Perfect Location, Wonderful staff, Slept great

aka: Marriott Springhill Suites Old Montreal Hotel Montreal
description: Discover the Marriott SpringHill Suites Old Montreal. Warm and welcoming hospitality in the heart of charming and historic Old Montreal. All the feature comforts of a large international hotel chain for your short or long stay. At mealtime, experience the enchanting Auberge Le Saint Gabriel restaurant, one of the oldest inns in North America, affiliated with the hotel to better serve you.Offering state-of-the-art business services for your conferences, training or motivational seminars, the Marriott SpringHill Suites Old Montreal is also the ideal place for a magical stay!
